sections.heading: What is Startup India Registration?
content: Startup India Registration is a recognition granted by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT).
It acts as an official approval that allows startups to access tax benefits, funding opportunities, and government support.
This registration does not create a business entity. Your business must already be incorporated as a Private Limited Company, LLP, or One Person Company.

sections.heading: Important Note on Tax Exemption
content: DPIIT recognition alone does not automatically grant tax exemptions.
Separate approval from the Inter-Ministerial Board (IMB) is required for income tax benefits.
We can assist you with the IMB application process as well.

list.title: Is Startup India registration mandatory?
points: No, it is optional but highly beneficial for eligible startups.

list.title: Can an existing business apply?
points: Yes, as long as it is less than 10 years old and meets eligibility conditions.

list.title: Does Startup India registration guarantee funding?
points: No, but it significantly improves access to government funds and investor networks.

list.title: Is GST registration required for Startup India?
points: GST requirements depend on business type and turnover and are independent of Startup India registration.
